author: @thabresh_
text: Certainly, here's the list of technical skills for different levels:  Entry Level: - Excel - SQL - BI Tool (Tableau/Power BI)  Mid Level: - Excel - SQL - BI Tool (Tableau/Power BI) - R/Python - Cloud Platform (Azure/AWS) - Data Cleaning - Data Manipulation  Senior Level: - Excel - SQL - BI Tool (Tableau/Power BI) - R/Python - Cloud Platform (Azure/AWS) - Data Cleaning - Data Manipulation - Data Modeling - Forecasting

author: @KeepKuul
text: Great Video Alex! I'm also changing careers.  Been in the banking industry ((commercial) real estate mortgage broker + significant experience with stocks and derivatives) for about 14 years. I've also been in crypto for about 8 years now.. So, I have a very good domain/industry knowledge. At the moment I'm getting the following Azure certs: AZ900, AI900, DP900 (all fundamentals), AZ104 (administator), DP (data scientist), DP203 (Data Engineer) certs. I also did SCRUM foundation and ITIL 4 foundation. I also have a short ~100hour python bootcamp ahead of me with that focus.  Goal is to go into Data Analytics/Data Science, obviously still a way to go. I'm a fast learner and adapt quick. At the moment based in germany, but will move to LA, California in Q1 next year.  Any advice on what I should go for or can expect? (job perspective with my profile, salary)  My goal would be to work for a financial instution, fintech, tech company etc.  Thank you very much in advance.
